nl.nikhef.jgridstart.gui.util

Class URLLauncher

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.nikhef.jgridstart.gui.util.URLLauncher
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    URLLauncherCertificate

    public class URLLauncher
extends Object
    URL Handler to external webbrowser and Action invocation.

    This method is used to handle opening of URLs. All URLs are opened with an external web browser via BrowserFactory, but action: URLs are handled specially.

    An action: URL activates an Actions actionPerformed method, so it is equivalent to selecting a menu item or pressing a button. Before an action can be called as URL, it must be made known using addAction(java.lang.String, javax.swing.Action), for example: 

       class CoolAction extends AbstractAction {
     public CoolAction() {
       super();
       putValue(NAME, "Cool thing...");
       URLLauncher.addAction("cool", this);
     }
     public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
       System.out.println("Cool down "+e.getActionCommand());
     }
   }
    It is then possible to launch the action by invoking URLLauncher.openURL("action:cool").

    Actions can have an argument specified in brackets, which sets the ActionEvent's command. So when URLLauncher.openURL("action:cool(please)") would be invoked, CoolAction's actionPerformed method would print "Cool down please".

    The API is compatible with BareBonesBrowserLaunch (original version), so this could be used as a drop-in replacement to add action-handling.

    Author:
    wvengen

      • openURL

        public static void openURL(URL url)
        Open an URL

        This is equal to openURL(url, null) so any error dialog will have no parent.

        Parameters:
        url - url to open

      • openURL

        public static void openURL(String surl)
        Open a string URL

        This is equal to openURL(url, null) so any error dialog will have no parent.

        Parameters:
        surl - url to open (as String)

      • performAction

        public static void performAction(String action,
                                 Component parent)
        Perform an action.

        This method is called for each action: URL, it calls ActionListener.actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent) of the specified action.

        If the action is not found in the list of known actions, an error dialog is shown.

        Parameters:
        action - name of action to perform
        parent - parent

      • addAction

        public static void addAction(String name,
                             Action a)
        Add an Action to the list of recognised actions.

        It is suggested to run this in an Action's constructor like this: 

           class MyAction extends AbstractAction {
     
     public MyAction() {
       super("MyAction");
       ActionHandler.addAction("myaction", this);
     }
     
     public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
       // ...
     }
   }
        See also this class's description.
        Parameters:
        name - name in url, e.g. "myaction" to respond to url "action:myaction"
        a - Action to perform when url is opened

        public static Action getAction(String name)
        Return a previously added action
